name: ...'Cause Stone Cold Said So!
effect:
May only be played if the card titled And That's the Bottom Line... is in your Ring area. You may remove any Action card from your opponent's Ring area and
place it in his Ringside pile.
When in play, you may discard this card (including opponent's turn) and your next card played this turn can be played regardless of the Fortitude value.
Unique
"And That's the Bottom Line..." - Austin

name: Adrenaline Rush
effect:
Choose up to 10 cards in your Ringside pile; your opponent returns 3 to your Ringside pile and the others you may shuffle into your Arsenal.
"Something just surged inside him - there's no way anybody will be able to stop him!!!" - Paul Heyman

name: Adrenaline Rush
effect:
Choose up to 10 cards in your Ringside pile; your opponent returns 3 to your Ringside pile and the others you may shuffle into your Arsenal.
"Something just surged inside him - there's no way anybody will be able to stop him!!!" - Paul Heyman

name: Amazing Display of Power
effect:
Cannot be played by Stone Cold Steve Austin or Tazz.
Draw 1 card.
When this card is in your Ring area, all your Grapple maneuvers are +3D.
You may not have more than one Amazing Display of Power card in your Ring area at a time.

name: Ambush Finalé
effect:
You must play a Heel maneuver card before playing this card.
When successfully played, you may take 2 cards in your opponent's Ring area and put them into his Ringside pile.
Unique
Stun Value: 2
"We'll take you out using any means necessary, punk!" - Triple H

name: And That's the Bottom Line ...
effect:
Reverse any Strike, Grapple, or Submission maneuver and end your opponent's turn. Look through your Ringside pile and then your Arsenal for the card titled ...
'Cause Stone Cold Said So! and place that card in your hand, then shuffle your Arsenal if you looked through it.
If played by the Two Man Power Trip this card is F:9, if played by Stone Cold Steve Austin this card is F:18.
Unique

name: Arm Bar
effect:
When successfully played, discard 1 card of your choice from your hand.
"He's wearing the man down with that simple maneuver." - Jim Ross

name: Arm Bar Takedown
effect:
As an action, you may discard this card to draw 1 card. Doing this will not cause any damage to opponent.
"Great use of leverage!" - Kevin Kelly

name: Arm Drag
effect:
When successfully played, discard 1 card of your choice from your hand.
"Textbook maneuver for any wrestler." - Jim Ross

name: Arm Wrench
effect:
Add +1D for every maneuver card with the word "Arm" in the title in your Ring Area.
"Old school wrestling: you pick a body part, and you work it." - Jim Ross

name: Backed by Mr. McMahon
effect:
At the end of the Pre-match phase, determine if you are the player with the highest Superstar Value. If you have the highest Superstar Value then your opponent
must choose to do two of the following:
Discard 2 cards, Allow you to draw 2 cards, Overturn 7 cards from his Arsenal, Play with his hand face up until the beginning of the second turn of the match, Skip
his first turn, or Concede and lose the match.
Unique

name: Backed by Stephanie McMahon
effect:
Your opponent must take the top # of cards from his Arsenal and put them into his Ringside pile. # = Total Superstar Value of your opponent.
Shuffle any 3 cards from your Ringside pile into your Arsenal.
"I'm certain you'll be wearing the gold!" - Stephanie McMahon

name: Backhand Slap
effect:
When successfully played, choose one: draw 1 card, or you may look at your opponent's hand.
"That'll wipe the taste outta your mouth!" - Jim Ross

name: Backhand Slap
effect:
When successfully played, choose one: draw 1 card, or you may look at your opponent's hand.
"That'll wipe the taste outta your mouth!" - Jim Ross

name: Bait Opponent
effect:
Your next maneuver this turn is -6F and your opponent's reversal to it is +6F.
"Why don't you come down here and we'll see about that, right now!" - Triple H

name: Bear Hug
effect:
When successfully played, opponent must discard 1 card.
"Just like a big ol' grizzly!" - Jim Ross

name: Big Boot
effect: "That knocked a few teeth loose!" - Jim Ross

name: Big Splash In the Corner
effect:
You must play the card titled Throw Into the Corner Turnbuckle before playing this card.
When successfully played, opponent must discard 1 card.
Reversals to this maneuver are +2D.
Stun Value: 1

name: Body Slam
effect:
SV: 1
"That might look easy, but he just lifted a 300lbs. man!" - Michael Cole

name: Boot to the Face
effect:
May only reverse the cards titled Throw into the Corner Turnbuckle or Irish Whip. End your opponent's turn.
Unique
Stun Value: 1
"Right in the puss, how's that leather taste?" - Paul Heyman

name: Brainbuster
effect:
If successfully played against Stone Cold Steve Austin, he must discard 2 cards.
Stun Value: 1
"Looked like a suplex - then he just dropped him on his head! I like it!" - Tazz

name: Break the Hold
effect:
Reverse any Submission maneuver and end your opponent's turn.
"He's gonna get outta it! He's reaching for the side rope." - Jim Ross

name: Break the Hold
effect:
Reverse any Submission maneuver and end your opponent's turn.
"He's gonna get outta it! He's reaching for the side rope." - Jim Ross

name: Brothers of Destruction
effect:
Superstar Ability:
You may play or be affected by cards that refer specifically to Undertaker/Dead Man Inc. or Kane. You may play the card titled Brothers 'til the End.
You may forfeit drawing a card at the start of your turn, and place the top 2 cards of your Arsenal into your Ringside pile. Then choose any card in your Ringside
pile and place it in your hand.
You may not play any title belt except the Tag Team Title Belts.

name: Calling You Out
effect:
Look at your opponent's Backlash Deck, you may put any 1 Pre-match card into play in his Ring area. If you put a card into play from his deck, then you may
proceed with playing your next Pre-match card; otherwise, end your turn.
Unique

name: Chain Lashing
effect:
As a maneuver, can only be played if your Fortitude Rating is greater than your opponent's Fortitude Rating.
When successfully played, opponent must place 1 random card from his Backlash deck into his Ringside pile.
Unique
Stun Value: 2
"I can't look at this!" - Jim Ross

name: Chains of Destruction
effect:
At the start of your turn, before your draw segment, your opponent must overturn the top card from his Arsenal into his Ringside pile and then discard 1 card. You
must overturn the top card from your Arsenal into your Ringside pile.
Unique
"Looks like things here are gonna get out of control fast!" - Jim Ross

name: Chair Shot
effect:
SV: 1
"That's solid steel, folks. There ain't no give!" - Jim Ross

name: Choke Hold
effect:
When successfully played, opponent must discard 1 card.
"Hey, ref, stop him, that's an illegal hold!" - Jim Ross

name: Chokeslam to Hell
effect:
May only reverse a Strike or Grapple maneuver, if your Fortitude Rating is less than your opponent's Fortitude Rating.
Unique
Stun Value: 3
"Good God, they'll put 'em through the mat fer sure!" - Jim Ross

name: Chop
effect:
As an action, you may discard this card to draw 1 card. Doing this will not cause any damage to opponent.
"That's gonna leave a mark!" - Jim Ross

name: Chop
effect:
As an action, you may discard this card to draw 1 card. Doing this will not cause any damage to opponent.
"That's gonna leave a mark!" - Jim Ross

name: Chop to the Chest
effect:
When successfully played, if your next card played this turn is a maneuver it is +1D and your opponent's reversal to it is +1F; when played by Chris Benoit, you may also search your Arsenal for a card titled Chop to the Chest, place that card in your hand then shuffle your Arsenal.
"That's gotta hurt!" - Michael Cole

name: Chop to the Chest
effect:
When successfully played, if your next card played this turn is a maneuver it is +1D and your opponent's reversal to it is +1F; when played by Chris Benoit, you may also search your Arsenal for a card titled Chop to the Chest, place that card in your hand then shuffle your Arsenal.
"That's gotta hurt!" - Michael Cole

name: Clumsy Opponent
effect:
May reverse any maneuver of 4D or less and end opponent's turn.
You may draw 1 card.
"No one's ever going to call me a clumsy opponent - I don't trip over my own feet like some kind of dummy!" - Tazz

name: Clumsy Opponent
effect:
May reverse any maneuver of 4D or less and end opponent's turn.
You may draw 1 card.
"No one's ever going to call me a clumsy opponent - I don't trip over my own feet like some kind of dummy!" - Tazz

name: Clutch onto Opponent
effect:
May only be reversed by the card titled Clean Break.
The card titled Maintain Hold cannot be played after this card.
"If only he could keep this going, somehow maintain this hold, he'd win for sure!" - Kevin Kelly

name: Clutch onto Opponent
effect:
May only be reversed by the card titled Clean Break.
The card titled Maintain Hold cannot be played after this card.
"If only he could keep this going, somehow maintain this hold, he'd win for sure!" - Kevin Kelly

name: Critical Injury
effect:
Can only be played after a 5D or greater maneuver.
While this card is in your Ring area, your opponent's Superstar Ability is considered to read as blank text.
(Superstar Abilities relating to Arsenal construction are not affected)

name: Debilitating Injury: Arm/Elbow
effect:
Can only be played if the last two cards you played this turn were 4D or greater maneuvers, make note of opponent this card is played against.
When this card is in your Ring Area, if opponent's Fortitude Rating is less than yours, all of his maneuver card effect text is considered blank when played.
Unique

name: Debilitating Injury: Knee/Leg
effect:
Can only be played if the last two cards you played this turn were 6D or greater maneuvers, make note of opponent this card is played against. Opponent must
discard 1 card.
When this card is in your Ring area, you may put it in your Ringside pile to reverse any Action card played by debilitated opponent.
Unique

name: Defensive Posture
effect:
When you play this card announce one of the following: Strike, Grapple, Submission, or High Risk maneuver. You may not have more than one Defensive Posture card in your Ring area at a time.
When this card is in your Ring area, you may put it into your Ringside pile to reverse the type of maneuver named and end your opponent's turn.

name: Dirty Low Blow
effect:
Only playable if your Fortitude Rating is less than your opponent's Fortitude Rating.
May not be reversed from your opponent's hand.
Stun Value: 1

name: Double Leg Takedown
effect:
When successfully played, you may draw 1 card.
"Flat on your back, that'll slow you down. Ha!" - Jerry "The King" Lawler

name: Drop Toe Hold
effect:
When successfully played, you may take 1 card in your opponent's Ring area and put it into his Ringside pile.
"That will set you back! Right, JR?" - Jerry "The King" Lawler

name: Elbow Drop
effect:
Can only be played after a 4D or greater maneuver.
When successfully played, you may draw 1 card.
"Great chain wrestling: dropped him, then planted him!" - Jim Ross

name: Elbow to the Face
effect:
May reverse any maneuver that does 7D or less. End your opponent's turn.
"Hard shot right to the nose, that will stop most anything." - Jim Ross

name: Elbow to the Face
effect:
May reverse any maneuver that does 7D or less. End your opponent's turn.
"Hard shot right to the nose, that will stop most anything." - Jim Ross

name: Entangle In the Ropes
effect:
Can only be played after a 4D or greater maneuver.
When successfully played, you may draw 1 card and your opponent must discard 1 card.
"Hey, ref, stop him! He's torturing the hell outta him!" - Jim Ross

name: Escape Move
effect:
Reverse any Grapple maneuver and end your opponent's turn.
"Nice Greco-Roman style counter!" - Jim Ross

name: Escape Move
effect:
Reverse any Grapple maneuver and end your opponent's turn.
"Nice Greco-Roman style counter!" - Jim Ross

name: Eye Rake
effect:
As a maneuver, when successfully played, if the next card you play this turn is a Strike or Grapple, it can not be reversed.
As a reversal, can reverse any Grapple maneuver and ends your opponent's turn. If the first card you play on your turn is a Strike or Grapple maneuver, it can not be reversed.

name: Falling Fist
effect:
Can only be played after a 4D or greater maneuver.
When successfully played, reveal your hand to your opponent.
"I couldn't have done it better myself!" - Jerry "The King" Lawler

name: Flip Over the Corner Ringpost
effect:
As an action, you may take 1 card from Ringside pile and this card, shuffle them into your Arsenal. Draw 2 cards and then discard 1 card from your hand.
As a reversal, may only reverse the card titled Throw Opponent Into the Corner Turnbuckle. Take the top 3 cards of your Arsenal and put them into your Ringside
pile; then take any 3 cards from your Ringside pile, and put them into your hand. End your opponent's turn.
Unique

name: Foot Stomp
effect:
Can only be played after a 4D or greater maneuver.
Stun Value: 1
"He's stompin' a mudhole in him and walkin' it dry!" - Jim Ross

name: Garbage Can Lid
effect:
As a reversal, if this card is in your Ring area, you may place it in your Ringside pile to reverse any Strike or Grapple maneuver. Opponent must put the top 3 cards of his Arsenal into his Ringside pile. End opponent's turn.
Stun Value: 1
"He's got great street smarts." - Tazz

name: Giving Away the Business
effect:
As an action, search your Arsenal for any 1 card, put it in your hand, then shuffle your Arsenal. Reveal your hand to your opponent.
As a reversal, reverse any Action card that would allow your opponent to draw one or more cards.

name: Go for the Cheap Pop!
effect:
Shuffle up to 3 cards from your Ringside pile into your Arsenal.
"The title's on the line, right here, tonight in Milwaukee!" - Commissioner Mick Foley

name: Hair Pull
effect:
When successfully played, you may look at your opponent's hand.
"I know you're enjoying this, King!" - Jim Ross

name: Headlock Takedown
effect:
When successfully played, opponent must draw 1 card.
"Great amateur move!" - Jim Ross

name: Hebner Calls It
effect:
Reverse any RUN-IN Action, HEEL Action or FOREIGN OBJECT card being played by your opponent from his hand. It is unsuccessful, goes to his Ringside pile, has no effect and ends his turn.
"The referee isn't going to allow that!" - Michael Cole

name: Hip Toss
effect: "Up and over!" - Kevin Kelly

name: It's Time to Play the Game
effect:
If your Fortitude Rating is less than your opponent's, take any 4 cards from your Ringside pile and shuffle them into your Arsenal.
If your Fortitude Rating is equal to your opponent's, remove any 1 card from your opponent's Ring area and place it in his Ringside pile.
If your Fortitude Rating is greater than your opponent's, look at your opponent's hand and choose 1 card he must discard.
Unique

name: Jaw Jammer
effect:
When successfully played, opponent must place 1 card in his hand back on top of his Arsenal.
"Sumph-ugh-umph-bunch!" - Quote from the last wrestler who received a Jaw Jammer.

name: Jaw Jammer
effect:
When successfully played, opponent must place 1 card in his hand back on top of his Arsenal.
"Sumph-ugh-umph-bunch!" - Quote from the last wrestler who received a Jaw Jammer.

name: Kick
effect:
When successfully played, you must take the top card of your Arsenal and put it into your Ringside pile.
"He took a big chance on that one and it paid off!" - Jerry "The King" Lawler

name: Kick
effect:
When successfully played, you must take the top card of your Arsenal and put it into your Ringside pile.
"He took a big chance on that one and it paid off!" - Jerry "The King" Lawler

name: Knee Smash
effect:
Can only be played after a 4D or greater maneuver.
When successfully played, you must take the top card of your Arsenal and put it into your Ringside pile.
"What unbelievable accuracy!" - Michael Cole

name: Leg Drop
effect:
Can only be played after a 5D or greater maneuver.
When successfully played, end your turn.
Stun Value: 1
"The most devastating move in professional wrestling ... at least in the eighties!" - Jim Ross

name: Lift a Boot
effect:
May only reverse a High Risk maneuver if played from your hand. End your opponent's turn.
"He came to at the last moment." - Jim Ross

name: Lift a Boot
effect:
May only reverse a High Risk maneuver if played from your hand. End your opponent's turn.
"He came to at the last moment." - Jim Ross

name: McMahon-Helmsley Era
effect:
Playable only if your Fortitude Rating is less than your opponent's Fortitude Rating.
Draw 2 cards. After you do this, if your opponent has more cards in his hand than you, draw 1 more card.
"Boys, it's a whole new game!" - Triple H

name: Neck Breaker
effect:
As a reversal, may reverse the card titled Back Body Drop.
When successfully played, your opponent must discard 1 card, and if played against Stone Cold Steve Austin, look at his hand.
"He might've just broken his neck!" - Michael Cole

name: Offer Handshake
effect:
Draw up to 3 cards, then discard 1 card.
"I'm putting my hand out, son, shake It." - Stone Cold Steve Austin

name: Old School Wrestling Match
effect:
Your opponent's next Pre-match card played reads as blank text. When played their card has no effect and should be placed in their Ringside pile.
Unique

name: Piledriver
effect:
When successfully played, opponent must discard 1 card.
Stun Value: 1

name: Punch
effect: "Pow! Right in the kisser!" - Jerry "The King" Lawler

name: Punch
effect: "Pow! Right in the kisser!" - Jerry "The King" Lawler

name: Puppies! Puppies!
effect:
Shuffle up to 5 cards from your Ringside pile into your Arsenal. Then draw 2 cards.
"Puppies! Puppies! Oops ... my attention was elsewhere JR, what just happened?" - Jerry "The King" Lawler

name: Quick Count Ref
effect:
Can only be played after an 8D or greater maneuver.
When successfully played, you win the game via a Pin Victory condition.
"And your guest referee is none other than, Shane McMahon!" - Vince McMahon

name: Recovery
effect:
Shuffle any 2 cards from your Ringside pile back into your Arsenal. Then draw 1 card.
"Looks like he's getting his second wind. And it ain't smelling so good!" - Jerry "The King" Lawler

name: Reverse DDT
effect:
When successfully played, you may draw 1 card.
"Great twist to a classic maneuver!" - Kevin Kelly

name: Roll Out of the Ring
effect:
Discard up to 2 cards from your hand to your Ringside pile. Return an equal number of cards of your choice to your hand from your Ringside pile.
"Looks like he's outta there, needs time for a breather!" - Jim Ross

name: Roll Out of the Way
effect:
As an action, you may shuffle this card into your Arsenal and draw 1 card.
As a reversal, this card can not be played from your hand. When overturned from your Arsenal may reverse any High Risk maneuver and end your opponent's turn.
"Oh, that's a huge miss!" - Jim Ross

name: Roll Out of the Way
effect:
As an action, you may shuffle this card into your Arsenal and draw 1 card.
As a reversal, this card can not be played from your hand. When overturned from your Arsenal may reverse any High Risk maneuver and end your opponent's turn.
"Oh, that's a huge miss!" - Jim Ross

name: Rollin' - Rollin' - Rollin'!
effect:
Can only be played after a successfully played maneuver. Search your Arsenal or Ringside pile for a non-unique card of the same type of maneuver successfully
played, show it to your opponent, place it in your hand, then shuffle your Arsenal. If that maneuver is the next card you play, it is +2D and cannot be reversed.
Unique

name: Roundhouse Punch
effect: "He's rearing back and gonna unload another shot!" - Kevin Kelly

name: Running Lariat
effect:
May not be reversed by the card titled Elbow to the Face. Reversals to this maneuver are +2D. If reversed from your opponent's hand, and his first card played on his next turn is a maneuver it cannot be reversed.
"Sometimes... you have to take a chance and take it... to the EXTREME!!!" - Paul Heyman

name: Scoop Slam
effect:
When successfully played, discard 1 card and opponent must discard 2 cards.
"That's a totally cool move!" ... "Yeah, we should do it more often!" - Edge & Christian

name: Set Him Up
effect:
Can only be played if you reversed a maneuver from your hand to end your opponent's last turn and this is the first card you play on your turn.
You may search your Arsenal for any non-unique maneuver, show it to opponent, put it into your hand and then shuffle your Arsenal.

name: Shoulder Breaker
effect:
When successfully played, you may search your Arsenal for the card titled Arm Bar and put it in your hand, then shuffle your Arsenal. If Arm Bar is the next card you play this turn it is +2D.
"Folks, this can't be good!" - Jim Ross

name: Small Concealed Foreign Object
effect:
Can only be played after a successfully played Strike maneuver. Draw 1 card.
When this card is in your Ring area all your Strike maneuvers are +1D.
If you attempt to play any other maneuver card other than a Strike while this card is in your Ring area, put this card in your Ringside pile.

name: Snap Mare
effect:
When successfully played, if your next card played this turn is a Strike maneuver it is +2D.
"You know he's setting him up for something ..." - Kevin Kelly

name: Spit at Opponent
effect:
You discard 1 card. Your opponent discards 4 cards.
"How disgraceful!" - Jim Ross

name: Stagger
effect:
Play after a successfully played maneuver. If your next card played this turn is a maneuver of 7D or less your opponent can not reverse it.
"He's nearly done. He's just got to put his man away!" - Jim Ross

name: Standing Side Headlock
effect:
When successfully played, opponent must draw 1 card.
"Slapped that one on tight and synching it up!" - Jim Ross

name: Step Aside
effect:
Reverse any Strike maneuver and end your opponent's turn.
"I thought he had him!" - Jerry "The King" Lawler

name: Step Aside
effect:
Reverse any Strike maneuver and end your opponent's turn.
"I thought he had him!" - Jerry "The King" Lawler

name: Student of the Sport
effect:
You must take the top 2 cards from your Arsenal and put them into your Ringside pile.
When this card is in your Ring area, you may put it in your Ringside pile as a Mid-match Action, then select one: look at your opponent's Backlash deck or his hand.

name: Study the Tapes
effect:
You must take the top 4 cards from your Arsenal and put them into your Ringside pile.
When the regular game sequence begins your (active) opponent must start the match with his hand face up on the table. At the end of your first turn your opponent may return his cards to his hand.

name: Study the Tapes
effect:
You must take the top 4 cards from your Arsenal and put them into your Ringside pile.
When the regular game sequence begins your (active) opponent must start the match with his hand face up on the table. At the end of your first turn your opponent may return his cards to his hand.

name: Taunt the Fans
effect: At the end of the Pre-match phase, you may search your Arsenal for 1 non-unique card, show it to your opponent and add it into your starting hand. Then your opponent randomly chooses 1 card from your hand that is discarded (no other card effects apply).

name: The Bigger They Are, the Harder They Fall
effect:
Can only be played after a successfully played maneuver and if your opponent's Fortitude Rating is greater than your Fortitude Rating.
Search your opponent's Arsenal for any 3 Reversal cards and place them in his Ringside pile, then shuffle his Arsenal.
Unique
"What a turn of events!" - Michael Cole

name: Throttled Within an Inch of Your Life
effect:
Cannot be reversed from your opponent's hand.
When successfully played your opponent must overturn cards until 2 applicable reversals are revealed (first applicable reversal does not end turn) or only one card
remains in his Arsenal. This maneuver is not effected by any other cards that you have played or are in your Ring area.
Unique

name: Throw Into the Corner Turnbuckle
effect:
As an action, if your next card played this turn is a Strike it is +6D or if it is a Grapple your opponent's reversal will be +12F.
As a reversal, may only reverse the card titled Throw Into the Corner Turnbuckle, opponent must discard 1 card. You end your opponent's turn; and if your next card played on your turn is a Strike it is +6D or if it is a Grapple your opponent's reversal will be +12F.

name: Throw Into the Corner Turnbuckle
effect:
As an action, if your next card played this turn is a Strike it is +6D or if it is a Grapple your opponent's reversal will be +12F.
As a reversal, may only reverse the card titled Throw Into the Corner Turnbuckle, opponent must discard 1 card. You end your opponent's turn; and if your next card played on your turn is a Strike it is +6D or if it is a Grapple your opponent's reversal will be +12F.

name: Tiger Bomb
effect:
When successfully played, if you discard 2 cards your next card played may not be reversed.
"He drove him straight down into the mat!!! He's going to be feeling that for weeks!!!" - Paul Heyman

name: Trash Talkin' Interview
effect: When this card is in your Ring area, you may place it in your Ringside pile as a Mid-match Action and choose any 4 cards in your Ringside pile and shuffle them back into your Arsenal.

name: Two Man Power Trip
effect:
Superstar Ability:
You may play or be affected by cards that refer specifically to Stone Cold Steve Austin or Triple H. You may also use their Superstar specific foil cards.
At the end of the Pre-match phase, determine if you are the player with the highest Superstar Value. If so, add 3 cards to your starting hand.
Opponent cannot play the cards titled: Backed by Stephanie McMahon or Billion Dollar Princess.
You may not play any title belt except the Tag Team Title Belts.

name: When You Thought You Had All the Answers ...
effect:
Cannot be played if your Trademark Finisher is in your Ring area.
May reverse any Trademark Finisher, EVEN if it cannot be reversed. (Yeap!)
Your opponent must shuffle the Trademark Finisher back into his Arsenal and may draw 1. End your opponent's turn.

name: World Wrestling Federation Tag Team Title Belts
effect:
Unless your Superstar starter card lists that you may play this card; this card may only be played in a multiplayer Tag Team match.
Superstar Value +2
Hand Size +1
Unique
(uses a different image than found on the regular Tag Team belt.)
